other_tests.findings: Three adenomas showed typical morphology of HNF1-Î± inactivated adenomas; one showed myxoid adenoma morphology. All adenomas were negative for PRKACA rearrangements by FISH analysis and showed complete loss or significant reduction of LFABP expression by immunohistochemistry.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One adenoma, which was resected in a 14-year-old female, was previously reported. Five years after the adenoma resection, a fibrolamellar carcinoma developed in the same lobe of the liver.

other_tests.findings: All four adenomas were negative for PRKACA rearrangements.
An average 10-fold reduction in LFABP protein levels compared with matched normal liver tissue.
All adenomas showed complete loss of LFABP staining; the adenoma from the patient with Carney complex showed partial LFABP loss and partial positivity for CRP.
Confirmed that the fibrolamellar carcinoma lacked PRKACA rearrangements.
